titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Surrogate's Court summons to Nathaniel Mills 1977.507
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:42 +0000.

did.unittitle: Queens County Surrogate's Court summons to Nathaniel Mills
did.abstract: Summons from the Queens County Surrogate's Court to Nathaniel Mills of 1393 Pacific Street in Brooklyn. The summons orders Mills, an executor of the estate of Elias J. Hendrickson of Hollis, Queens County, to appear in the Queens County Surrogate's Office in Jamaica for the probate of Hendrickson's last will and testament. It is dated February 4, 1892.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Surrogate's Court summons to Nathaniel Mills, 1977.507, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William A. Eardeley, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
